Address.Line: 5641 Medical Sciences II 1150 W. Medical Center Dr.

Platform.Title: University of Michigan E_coli_CFT073 5.4K array
Platform.Manufacture-Protocol: High-density DNA array prepared with Maskless Array Synthesizer (MAS) technology. See manufacturer's website at http://www.nimblegen.com/.

Column.Name: ACCESSION
Column.Description: GenBank accession number of E. coli CFT073 genome sequence

Column.Name: GENE_ID
Column.Description: Entrez GeneID number for the ORF to which the indicated probe set is directed.

Sample.Title: E_coli_AL051_vitro_rep1

Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA was extracted using the RNAprotect reagent (Qiagen Inc., Valencia, CA, USA) and the RNeasy Mini kit (Qiagen) and DNA was removed by TURBO DNase digestion (Ambion Inc., Austin, TX, USA). RNA quality was determined by analysis with an Agilent 2100 bioanalyzer at the University of Michigan Affymetrix and Microarray Core Facility (University of Michigan Medical School, Ann Arbor, MI USA) and RNA concentration determined with a NanoDrop ND-1000 spectrophotometer (Thermo Scientific, Rockford, IL, USA).
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: Labeling was performed by NimbleGen Systems Inc., Madison, WI USA, following their standard operating protocol. See www.nimblegen.com.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Hybridization was performed by NimbleGen Systems Inc., Madison, WI, USA following their standard operating protocol. See www.nimblegen.com.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Scanning was performed by NimbleGen Systems Inc., Madison, WI USA, following their standard operating protocol. See www.nimblegen.com.
Sample.Description: First of three biological replicates of E. coli patient isolate 051 cultured in vitro.
Sample.Data-Processing: The raw data (.pair file) was subjected to RMA (Robust Multi-Chip Analysis; Irizarry et al. Biostatistics 4(2):249), quantile normalization (Bolstad et al. Bioinformatics 19(2):185), and background correction as implemented in the NimbleScan software package (Roche NimbleGen, Inc.).

Series.Title: Escherichia coli global gene expression in urine from women with urinary tract infection
Series.Summary: Examination of E. coli transcripts present in bacteria in urine samples from 8 patients attending a urology clinic with symptoms of cystitis, as compared to transcripts present in the same E. coli strains during mid-exponential growth in filter-sterilized human urine in vitro.
Series.Overall-Design: A 48 array study using total RNA recovered from eight clinical E. coli isolates immediately following collection from women and following culture in pooled human urine ex vivo. Each array measures the expression of the 5,379 ORFs in the CFT073 genome, using an average of 14 60-mer probes per ORF. Arrays were performed in triplicate: biological replicates of the in vitro-cultured samples and technical replicates of the in vivo samples.
